description: Numbers n such that n divides number of positive divisors of n!.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
formula: It seems that a(n) is asymptotic to c*n with c=3.2..... - _Benoit Cloitre_, Sep 03 2002A027423(a(n)) mod a(n) = 0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 27 2013
example: 6 is OK because number of positive divisor of 6! is 30, which is divisible by 6.
mathematica: ok[n_] := Divisible[ DivisorSigma[0, n!], n]; Select[ Range[200], ok] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Dec 08 2011 *)
prog: (Haskell)a051178 n = a051178_list !! (n-1)a051178_list = filter (\x -> a027423 x `mod` x == 0) [1..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 27 2013
author: _Leroy Quet_
